short_description: Clusters data using a Gaussian Mixture Model.
long_description: Predicts cluster assignments using a Gaussian Mixture Model generated by GMMFit.

input_tables.name: testdata
input_tables.rDescription: Contains the data whose cluster values are to be predicted. The column names for the data to be classified must be the same as the column names in modeldata.
input_tables.description: Contains the data whose cluster values are to be predicted. The column names for the data to be classified must be the same as the column names in modeldata.

input_tables.name: modeldata
input_tables.rDescription: Contains a GMM model output by ta.gmmfit.
input_tables.description: Contains a GMM model output by GMMFit.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of newdata columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of testdata columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Attributes
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of newdata columns that correspond to the attributes in the modeldata table. By default, these columns are all newdata columns except the first
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of testdata columns that correspond to the attributes in the modeldata table. By default, these columns are all testdata columns except the first

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table column that defines the row identifier. The default value is the first input table column.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table column that defines the row identifier. The default value is the first input table column.

argument_clauses.name: OutputFormat
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies how the function outputs the weights that it assigns to each of the top N clusters: • 'sparse' (default): The function outputs each weight to a separate row of the output table. • 'dense': The function outputs the weights to a single row of the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies how the function outputs the weights that it assigns to each of the top N clusters: • 'sparse' (default): The function outputs each weight to a separate row of the output table. • 'dense': The function outputs the weights to a single row of the output table.

argument_clauses.name: TopNClusters
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of cluster weights that the function outputs. This value must be an INTEGER. For the value n, the function outputs for each data point the cluster with the greatest weight, the cluster with the second-greatest weight, and so on, ending with the cluster with the kth-greatest weight. The default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of cluster weights that the function outputs. This value must be an INTEGER. For the value n, the function outputs for each data point the cluster with the greatest weight, the cluster with the second-greatest weight, and so on, ending with the cluster with the kth-greatest weight. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: PrintLogLikelihood
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output the log likelihood of an observation, given the data. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to output the log likelihood of an observation, given the data. The default value is 'false'.
